intro: Clidemia laxiflora, commonly known as the creeping waxplant, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of the Americas. It belongs to the family Melastomataceae and is characterized by its prostrate growth habit and hairy stems. The plant produces small, showy flowers that are typically pink or white, with five petals and numerous stamens. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and often have a waxy coating, contributing to its common name. Clidemia laxiflora is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forest floors and stream banks.
